intro: Centaurea kuhdashtensis, commonly known as the Kuhdasht thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea kuhdashtensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
